title: The Headshot Intensive with Peter Hurley
summary: Renowned photographer Peter Hurley leads a workshop demonstrating his techniques for capturing professional headshots. The video highlights his methods for directing subjects, adjusting lighting, and building rapport to elicit genuine expressions, alongside testimonials from workshop participants.

steps.action: Direct the subject to adjust their posture, specifically instructing them to drop a shoulder.
Instruct the subject to lower their chin slightly to improve the angle.
Guide the subject's face direction relative to the camera and body position.
Review images on a screen to analyze lighting placement and catchlights in the eyes.
Direct the subject to turn their nose towards the light source for better illumination.
Critique student work on a projector to identify areas for improvement.
Coach the subject psychologically to stop caring about the shutter click to get a natural look.

key_takeaways: Directing the subject's micro-movements (chin, nose, shoulders) is essential for a polished look.
Lighting placement is critical, specifically how it creates catchlights in the eyes.
A major part of headshot photography is psychological: getting the subject to relax and stop 'performing' for the camera.
Reviewing and critiquing work immediately helps in understanding lighting and angles.
Confidence in your own style (e.g., white background, horizontal crop) is key to professional success.
